data.questionHtml: Write down each pair of adjacent angles shown in Fig.
data.solutionHtml:
Adjacent angles are the angles that have a common vertex and a common arm.
Following are the adjacent angles in the given figure:

∠DOC and ∠BOC∠COB and ∠BOA

data.questionHtml: In Fig., name all the pairs of adjacent angles.
data.solutionHtml:
In figure (i), the adjacent angles are:

∠EBA and∠ABC∠ACB and ∠BCF∠BAC and ∠CAD

In figure (ii), the adjacent angles are:

∠BAD and ∠DAC
∠BDA and ∠CDA

data.questionHtml: In figure, write down: (i) each linear pair (ii) each pair of vertically opposite angles.
data.solutionHtml:
(i) Two adjacent angles are said to form a linear pair of angles if their non-common arms are two opposite rays.
∠1 and ∠3
∠1 and ∠2
∠4 and ∠3
∠4 and ∠2
∠5 and ∠6
∠5 and ∠7
∠6 and ∠8
∠7 and ∠8

(ii) Two angles formed by two intersecting lines having no common arms are called vertically opposite angles.
∠1 and ∠4
∠2 and ∠3
∠5 and ∠8
∠6 and ∠7

data.questionHtml: Are the angles 1 and 2 given in Fig. adjacent angles?
data.solutionHtml: No, because they have no common vertex.

data.questionHtml:
Find the complement of each of the following angles:
(i) 35°
(ii) 72°
(iii) 45°
(iv) 85°
data.solutionHtml:
Two angles are called complementary angles if the sum of those angles is 90°.

Complementary angles of the following angles are:

i 90°-35°=55°ii 90°-72°=18°iii 90°-45°=45°iv 90°-85°=5°

data.questionHtml:
Find the supplement of each of the following angles:
(i) 70°
(ii) 120°
(iii) 135°
(iv) 90°
data.solutionHtml:
Two angles are called supplementary angles if the sum of those angles is 180°.
Supplementary angles of the following angles are:

(i) 180° − 70° = 110°
(ii) 180° − 120° = 60°
(iii) 180° − 135° = 45°
(iv) 180° − 90° = 90°

data.questionHtml:
Identify the complementary and supplementary pairs of angles from the following pairs:
(i) 25°, 65°
(ii) 120°, 60°
(iii) 63°, 27°
(iv) 100°, 80°
data.solutionHtml:
Since
(i) 25°+65°=90° , therefore this is complementary pair of angle. (ii) 120°+ 60°= 180°, therefore this is supplementary pair of angle.(iii) 63°+27°= 90°, therefore this is complementary pair of angle.(iv) 100°+ 80°= 180° , therefore this is supplementary pair of angle.

Therefore, (i) and (iii) are the pairs of complementary angles and (ii) and (iv) are the pairs of supplementary angles.

data.questionHtml:
Can two angles be supplementary, if both of them be
(i) obtuse?
(ii) right?
(iii) acute?
data.solutionHtml:
(i) No, two obtuse angles cannot be supplementary.
(ii) Yes, two right angles can be supplementary. (∵∠90°+∠90°=∠180°)
(iii) No, two acute angles cannot be supplementary.

data.questionHtml: Name the four pairs of supplementary angles shown in Fig.
data.solutionHtml:
Following are the supplementary angles:
∠AOC and ∠COB
∠BOC and ∠DOB
∠BOD and ∠DOA
∠AOC and ∠DOA

data.questionHtml:
In Fig., A, B, C are collinear points and ∠DBA = ∠EBA.

(i) Name two linear pairs
(ii) Name two pairs of supplementary angles.
data.solutionHtml:
(i) Linear pairs:
∠ABD and ∠DBC
∠ABE and ∠EBC

Because every linear pair forms supplementary angles, these angles are:
∠ABD and ∠DBC
∠ABE and ∠EBC

data.questionHtml: If two supplementary angles have equal measure, what is the measure of each angle?
data.solutionHtml:
Let x and y be two supplementary angles that are equal.
∠x=∠y
According to the question,
∠x+∠y=180°⇒∠x+∠x=180°⇒2∠x=180°⇒∠x=180°2=90°∴∠x=∠y=90°

data.questionHtml: If the complement of an angle is 28°, then find the supplement of the angle.
data.solutionHtml:
Let x be the complement of the given angle 28°.
∴ ∠x+28°=90°⇒∠x=90°-28°=62°
So, supplement of the angle = 180°-62°=118°

data.questionHtml: In Fig. 19, name each linear pair and each pair of vertically opposite angles:
data.solutionHtml:
Two adjacent angles are said to form a linear pair of angles if their non-common arms are two opposite rays.

∠1 and ∠2
∠2 and ∠3
∠3 and ∠4
∠1 and ∠4
∠5 and ∠6
∠6 and ∠7
∠7 and ∠8
∠8 and ∠5
∠9 and ∠10
∠10 and ∠11
∠11 and ∠12
∠12 and ∠9

Two angles formed by two intersecting lines having no common arms are called vertically opposite angles.
∠1 and ∠3
∠4 and ∠2
∠5 and ∠7
∠6 and ∠8
∠9 and ∠11
∠10 and ∠12

data.questionHtml: In Fig., OE is the bisector of ∠BOD. If ∠1 = 70°, find the magnitudes of ∠2, ∠3 and ∠4.
One of the angles forming a linear pair is a right angle. What can you say about its other angle?
data.solutionHtml:
One angle of a linear pair is the right angle, i.e., 90°.
∴ The other angle = 180°​ - 90° = 90​°

data.questionHtml: One of the angles forming a linear pair is an obtuse angle. What kind of angle is the other?
data.solutionHtml: If one of the angles of a linear pair is obtuse, then the other angle should be acute; only then can their sum be 180°.

data.questionHtml: One of the angles forming a linear pair is an acute angle. What kind of angle is the other?
data.solutionHtml: In a linear pair, if one angle is acute, then the other angle should be obtuse. Only then their sum can be 180°.

data.questionHtml: Can two acute angles form a linear pair?
data.solutionHtml: No, two acute angles cannot form a linear pair because their sum is always less than 180°.

data.questionHtml: If the supplement of an angle is 65°; then find its complement.
data.solutionHtml:
Let x be the required angle.
Then, we have: 
x + 65° = 180°
⇒x = 180° - 65° = 115°

The complement of angle x cannot be determined.

data.questionHtml: Find the value of x in each of the following figures.
data.solutionHtml:
(i)
Since ∠BOA+∠BOC=180°         (Linear pair)
∴ ∠x=180°-∠BOA=180°-60°=120°

(ii)
Since ∠QOP+∠QOR=180°         Linear pair∴2x+3x=180°⇒5x=180°⇒x=180°5=36°

(iii)
Since ∠LOP+∠PON+∠NOM=180°         Linear pair∴∠PON=180°-∠LOP-∠NOM⇒x=180°-35°-60°⇒x=180°-95°=85°

(iv)
Since ∠COD+∠DOE+∠EOA+∠AOB+∠BOC=360°         Sum of all angles at a point∴83°+92°+75°+47°+x=360°⇒297°+x=360°⇒x=360°-297°=63°

(v)
2x°+x°+2x°+3x°=180°⇒8x=180⇒x=1808=22.5°

(vi)
3x°=105°⇒x=1053=35°

data.questionHtml: In Fig. 22, it being given that ∠1 = 65°, find all other angles.
data.solutionHtml:
∠1=∠3          (Vertically opposite angles)
∴∠3=65°
Since ∠1+∠2=180°       (Linear pair)
∴∠2=180°-65°=115°
∠2=∠4          (Vertically opposite angles)
∴∠4=∠2=115° and ∠3=65°

data.questionHtml:
In Fig., OA and OB are opposite rays:


(i) If x = 25°, what is the value of y?
(ii) If y = 35°, what is the value of x?
data.solutionHtml:
∠AOC + ∠BOC = 180°                   (Linear pair)
⇒2y+5+3x=180°⇒3x+2y=175°
(i) If x = 25°, then
3×25°+2y=175°⇒75°+2y=175°⇒2y=175°-75°=100°⇒y=100°2=50°
(ii) If y = 35°, then
3x+2×35°=175°⇒3x+70°=175°⇒3x=175°-70°=105°⇒x=105°3=35°

data.questionHtml: In Fig., write all pairs of adjacent angles and all the linear pairs.
data.solutionHtml:
Adjacent angles:

∠DOA and ∠DOC∠DOC and ∠BOC

∠AOD and ∠DOB∠BOC and ∠AOC

Linear pairs of angles:

∠AOD and ∠DOB∠BOC and ∠AOC

data.questionHtml: In Fig. 25, find ∠x. Further find ∠BOC, ∠COD and ∠AOD.
data.solutionHtml:
∠AOD+∠DOC+∠COB=180°(Linear pair)(x+10)°+x°+(x+20)°=180°3x+30°=180°3x=180°-30°3x=150°x=150°3=50°
∠BOC=x+20°=50°+20°=70°∠COD=x=50°∠AOD=x+10°=50°+10°=60°

data.questionHtml: How many pairs of adjacent angles are formed when two lines intersect in a point?
data.solutionHtml: If two lines intersect at a point, then four adjacent pairs are formed, and those pairs are linear as well.

data.questionHtml: How many pairs of adjacent angles, in all, can you name in Fig.?
data.solutionHtml:
There are 10 adjacent pairs in the given figure; they are:
∠EOD and ∠DOC∠COD and ∠BOC∠COB and ∠BOA
∠AOB and ∠BOD∠BOC and ∠COE∠COD and ∠COA∠DOE and ∠DOB
∠EOD and ∠DOA∠EOC and ∠AOC∠AOB and ∠BOE

data.questionHtml: In Fig., POS is a line, find x.
data.solutionHtml:
∠QOP+∠QOR+∠ROS=180°       (Angles on a straight line)

⇒60°+4x+40°=180°⇒100°+4x=180°⇒4x=180°-100°=80°⇒x=80°4=20°

data.questionHtml: In Fig., lines l1 and l2 intersect at O, forming angles as shown in the figure. If x = 45°, find the values of y, z and u.
data.solutionHtml: ∠z=∠x=45°       Vertically opposite anglesNow,∠x+∠y=180°      Linear pair⇒∠y=180°-45°=135°∠u=∠y=135°       Vertically opposite angles

data.questionHtml: In Fig., three coplanar lines intersect at a point O, forming angles as shown in the figure. Find the values of x, y, z and u.
data.solutionHtml:
∠BOD + ∠DOF + ∠FOA = 180°        (Linear pair)
∴ ∠FOA = ∠u = 180°-90°-50°=40°
∠FOA=∠x=40°    (Vertically opposite angles)
∠BOD=∠z=90°    (Vertically opposite angles)
∠EOC=∠y=50°    (Vertically opposite angles)

data.questionHtml: In Fig., find the values of x, y and z.
data.solutionHtml: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>∠</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>25</mn><mo>°</mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>Vertically</mi><mo> </mo><mi>opposite</mi><mo> </mo><mi>angles</mi></mrow></mfenced><mspace linebreak="newline"/><mi>Since</mi><mo> </mo><mo>∠</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mo>∠</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>180</mn><mo>°</mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>Linear</mi><mo> </mo><mi>pair</mi></mrow></mfenced><mspace linebreak="newline"/><mo>∴</mo><mo>∠</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>180</mn><mo>°</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>25</mn><mo>°</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>155</mn><mo>°</mo><mspace linebreak="newline"/><mo>∠</mo><mi>z</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>∠</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>155</mn><mo>°</mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>Vertically</mi><mo> </mo><mi>opposite</mi><mo> </mo><mi>angles</mi></mrow></mfenced></math>

data.questionHtml:
In Fig., line n is a transversal to lines l and m. Identify the following:

(i) Alternate and corresponding angles in Fig. (i).
(ii) Angles alternate to ∠d and ∠g and angles corresponding to angles ∠f and ∠h in Fig. (ii).
(iii) Angle alternate to ∠PQR, angle corresponding to ∠RQF and angle alternate to ∠PQE in Fig. (iii).
(iv) Pairs of interior and exterior angles on the same side of the transversal in Fig. (ii).
data.solutionHtml:
(i) Figure (i)
Corresponding angles:
∠EGB and ∠GHD
∠HGB and ∠FHD
∠EGA and ∠GHC
∠AGH and ∠CHF
Alternate angles:
∠EGB and ∠CHF
∠HGB and ∠CHG
∠EGA and ∠FHD
∠AGH and ∠GHD

(ii) Figure (ii)
Alternate angle to ∠d is ∠e.
Alternate angle to ∠g is ∠b.
Also,
Corresponding angle to ∠f is ∠c.
Corresponding angle to ∠h is ∠a.

(iii) Figure (iii)
Angle alternate to ∠PQR is ∠QRA.
Angle corresponding to ∠RQF is ∠ARB.
Angle alternate to ∠POE is ∠ARB.

(iv) Figure (ii)
Pair of interior angles are
∠a and ∠e
∠d and ∠f
Pair of exterior angles are
∠b and ∠h
∠c and ∠g

data.questionHtml: In Fig., AB and CD are parallel lines intersected by a transversal PQ at L and M respectively. If ∠CMQ = 60°, find all other angles in the figure.
data.solutionHtml:
∠ALM = ∠CMQ = 60°        (Corresponding angles)
∠LMD = ∠CMQ = 60°        (Vertically opposite angles)
∠ALM = ∠PLB = 60°          (Vertically opposite angles)
Since
∠CMQ + ∠QMD = 180°     (Linear pair)
∴ ∠QMD = 180°-60°=120°
∠QMD = ∠MLB = 120°        (Corresponding angles)
∠QMD = ∠CML = 120°        (Vertically opposite angles)
∠MLB = ∠ALP = 120°          (Vertically opposite angles)

data.questionHtml: In Fig., AB and CD are parallel lines intersected by a transversal PQ at L and M respectively. If ∠LMD = 35° find ∠ALM and ∠PLA.
data.solutionHtml:
In the given Fig., AB || CD.
∠ALM=∠LMD=35°     Alternate interior anglesSince ∠PLA+∠ALM=180°     Linear pair∴∠PLA=180°-35°=145°

data.questionHtml: The line n is transversal to line l and m in Fig. Identify the angle alternate to ∠13, angle corresponding to ∠15, and angle alternate to ∠15.
data.solutionHtml:
In this given Fig., line l || m.
Here,
Alternate angle to ∠13 is ∠7.
Corresponding angle to ∠15 is ∠7.
Alternate angle to ∠15 is ∠5.

data.questionHtml: In Fig., line l || m and n is a transversal. If ∠1 = 40°, find all the angles and check that all corresponding angles and alternate angles are equal.
data.solutionHtml:
In the given figure, l || m.
Here,
∠1+∠2=180°     Linear pair∴ ∠2=180°-∠1=180°-40°=140°∠5=∠1=40°        Corresponding angles∠3=∠1=40°        Vertically opposite angles∠7=∠3=40°        Corresponding angles∠7=∠5=40°        Vertically opposite angles
Also,
∠2=∠6=140°        Corresponding angles∠2=∠4=140°        Vertically opposite angles∠4=∠8=140°        Corresponding angles∠8=∠6=40°          Vertically opposite angles
Thus,
∠2=∠8, ∠3=∠5, ∠6=∠4, ∠1=∠7
Hence, alternate angles are equal.

data.questionHtml: In Fig., line l || m and a transversal n cuts them at P and Q respectively. If ∠1 = 75°, find all other angles.
data.solutionHtml:
In the given figure, l || m, n is a transversal line and ∠1 = 75°.
Thus, we have:
∠1+∠2=180°        Linear pair⇒∠2=180°-∠1=180°-75°=105°∴∠1=∠5=75°         Corresponding angles∠1=∠3=75°             Vertically opposite angles∠5=∠7=75°             Vertically opposite anglesNow, ∠2=∠6=105°         Corresponding angles∠6=∠8=105°          Vertically opposite angles∠2=∠4=105°          Vertically opposite angles

data.questionHtml: In Fig., AB || CD and a transversal PQ cuts them at L and M respectively. If ∠QMD = 100°, find all other angles.
data.solutionHtml:
In the given figure, AB || CD, PQ is a transversal line and ∠QMD = 100°.
Thus, we have:
∠DMQ + ∠QMC = 180°    (Linear pair)
∴∠QMC=180°-∠DMQ=180°-100°=80°
Thus,
∠DMQ = ∠BLM = 100°         (Corresponding angles)
∠DMQ = ∠CML = 100°         (Vertically opposite angles)
∠BLM = ∠PLA = 100°           (Vertically opposite angles)
Also,
∠CMQ = ∠ALM = 80°         (Corresponding angles)
∠CMQ = ∠DML = 80°         (Vertically opposite angles)
∠ALM = ∠PLB = 80°           (Vertically opposite angles)

data.questionHtml: In Fig., l || m and p || q. Find the values of x, y, z, t.
data.solutionHtml:
In the given figure, l || m and p || q.
Thus, we have:
∠z=80°                (Vertically opposite angles)
∠z=∠t=80°       (Corresponding angles)
∠z=∠y=80°       (Corresponding angles)
∠x=∠y=80°       (Corresponding angles)

data.questionHtml: In Fig., line l || m, ∠1 = 120° and ∠2 = 100°, find out ∠3 and ∠4.
In Fig., line l || m. Find the values of a, b, c, d. Give reasons.
data.solutionHtml:
In the given figure, line l || m.
Thus, we have:
∠a=110°        Vertically opposite angles∠b=∠a=110°               Corresponding angles∠d=85°           Vertically opposite angles∠c=∠d=85°                  Corresponding angles

data.questionHtml: In Fig., AB || CD and ∠1 and ∠2 are in the ratio 3 : 2. Determine all angles from 1 to 8.
data.solutionHtml:
In the given figure, AB || CD and t is a transversal line.
Now, let:
∠1=3x∠2=2x
Thus, we have:
∠1+∠2=180°      Linear pair∴ 3x+2x=180°⇒5x=180°⇒x=180°5=36°Thus,∠1=3×36°=108°∠2=2×36°=72°
Now,
∠1=∠5=108°      Corresponding angles∠1=∠3=108°      Vertically opposite angles∠5=∠7=108°      Vertically opposite angles∠2=∠6=72°        Corresponding angles∠4=∠2=72°        Vertically opposite angles∠8=∠6=72°        Vertically opposite angles

data.questionHtml: In Fig., l, m and n are parallel lines intersected by transversal p at X, Y and Z respectively. Find ∠1, ∠2 and ∠3.
data.solutionHtml:
In the given figure, l || m || n and p is a transversal line.
Thus, we have:
∠4+60°=180°       Linear pair⇒∠4=180°-60°=120°∠4=∠1=120°       Corresponding angles∠1=∠2=120°        Corresponding angles ∠3=∠2=120°         Vertically opposite anglesThus,∠1=∠2=∠3=120°

data.questionHtml: In Fig., if l || m || n and ∠1 = 60°, find ∠2.
data.solutionHtml:
In the given figure, l || m || n and ∠1 = 60°.
Thus, we have:
∠3=∠1=60°     Corresponding angleNow,∠3+∠4=180°    Linear pair∠4=180°-∠3=180°-60°=120°∠2=∠4=120°      Alternate interior angles

data.questionHtml: In Fig., if AB || CD and CD || EF, find ∠ACE.
data.solutionHtml:
In the given figure, AB || CD and CD || EF.
Extend line CE to E'.

Thus, we have:
∠BAC=∠ACD=70°              Alternate anglesNow,∠3+∠CEF=180°                   Linear pair⇒∠3=180°-∠CEF=180°-130°=50°Since CD||EF, then∠2=∠3=50°                Corresponding angles∠ACE=∠ACD-∠2=70°-50°=20°

data.questionHtml: In Fig., if l || m, n || p and ∠1 = 85°, find ∠2.
data.solutionHtml:
In the given figure, l || m, n || p and ∠1 = 85°.
Now, let ∠4 be the adjacent angle of ∠2.
Thus, we have:
∠3=∠1=85°        Corresponding angles
∠3+∠2=180°       (Sum of interior angles on the same side of the transversal)
∴∠2=180°-∠3=180°-85°=95°

data.questionHtml: In Fig., a transversal n cuts two lines l and m. If ∠1 = 70° and ∠7 = 80°, is l || m?
data.solutionHtml:
We know that if the alternate exterior angles of two lines are equal, then the lines are parallel.
In the given figure, ∠1 and ∠7 are alternate exterior angles, but they are not equal.
 ∠1 ≠∠770°≠80°

Therefore, lines l and m are not parallel.

data.questionHtml: In Fig., a transversal n cuts two lines l and m such that ∠2 = 65° and ∠8 = 65°. Are the lines parallel?
data.solutionHtml:
∠2 = ∠3 = 65°        (Vertically opposite angles)   
 ∠8 = ∠6 = 65°         (Vertically opposite angles) 
∴ ∠3 = ∠6
⇒ l || m                       (Two lines are parallel if the alternate angles formed with the transversal are equal)

data.questionHtml: In Fig., show that AB || EF.
data.solutionHtml:
Extend line CE to E'.


∠BAC=57°=22°+35°=∠ACE+∠ECD∴ AB||CDHere, ∠E'EF+∠FEC=180°    Linear pair⇒∠E'EF=180°-∠FEC=180°-145°=35°=∠ECD ∴EF||CDThus, AB||CD ||EF

data.questionHtml: In Fig., AB || CD. Find the values of x, y, z.
data.solutionHtml:
∠x+125°=180°             (Linear pair)
∴∠x=180°-125°=55°

∠z=125°            (Corresponding angles)
∠x+∠z=180°   (Sum of adjacent interior angles is 180°)
∠x+125°=180°⇒∠x=180°-125°=55°

∠x+∠y=180°   (Sum of adjacent interior angles is 180°)
55°+∠y=180°⇒∠y=180°-55°=125°

data.questionHtml: In Fig., find out ∠PXR, if PQ || RS.
data.solutionHtml:
Draw a line parallel to PQ passing through X.


Here,
∠PQX=∠PXF=70° and ∠SRX=∠RXF=50°      (Alternate interior angles)
∵ PQ || RS || XF
∴ ∠PXR=∠PXF+∠FXR=70°+50°=120°

data.questionHtml:
In Fig., we have

(i) ∠MLY = 2 ∠LMQ, find ∠LMQ.
(ii) ∠XLM = (2x − 10)° and ∠LMQ = x + 30°, find x.
(iii) ∠XLM = ∠PML, find ∠ALY
(iv) ∠ALY = (2x − 15)°, and ∠LMQ = (x + 40)°, find x
data.solutionHtml:
(i)
∠LMQ=∠ALY          Corresponding angles∴∠MLY+ ∠ALY=180°             Linear pair   ⇒2∠ALY+∠ALY=180°⇒3∠ALY=180°⇒∠ALY=180°3=60°∴ ∠LMQ=60°

(ii)
∠XLM=∠LMQ                Alternate interior angles⇒2x-10°=x+30°⇒2x-x=30°+10°⇒x=40°

(iii)
∠ALX=∠LMP      Corresponding angles∠ALX+∠XLM=180°         Linear pair∠XLM=∠LMP         Given∴∠LMP+∠LMP=180°⇒2∠LMP=180° ⇒∠LMP=180° 2=90° ∠XLM=∠LMP=90°∠ALY=∠XLM       Vertically opposite angles∴∠ALY=90°   

(iv)
∠ALY=∠LMQ          Corresponding angles∴2x-15°=x+40°⇒2x-x=40°+15°⇒x=55°

data.questionHtml: In Fig., DE || BC. Find the values of x and y.
data.solutionHtml:
∠ABC = ∠DAB       (Alternate interior angles)
∴ x=40°

∠ACB = ∠EAC       (Alternate interior angles)
∴ y=55°

data.questionHtml: In Fig., line AC || line DE and ∠ABD = 32°. Find out the angles x and y if ∠E = 122°.
data.solutionHtml:
∠BDE=∠ABD=32°            Alternate interior angles⇒∠BDE+y=180°      Linear pair ⇒32°+y=180°⇒y=180°-32°=148°

∠ABE=∠E=122°         (Alternate interior angle)∠ABD+∠DBE=122°32°+x=122°x=122°-32°=90°

data.questionHtml: In Fig., side BC of ∆ABC has been produced to D and CE || BA. If ∠ABC = 65°, ∠BAC = 55°, find ∠ACE, ∠ECD and ∠ACD.
data.solutionHtml:
∠ABC = ∠ECD = 55°          (Corresponding angles)
∠BAC = ∠ACE = 65°          (Alternate interior angles)
Now, ∠ACD = ∠ACE + ∠ECD
⇒ ∠ACD = 55° + 65° = 120°

data.questionHtml: In Fig., line CA ⊥ AB || line CR and line PR || line BD. Find ∠x, ∠y and ∠z.
data.solutionHtml:
Since CA ⊥ AB,
∴∠x=90°
We know that the sum of all the angles of triangle is 180°.
In ∆APQ,∠QAP+∠APQ+∠PQA=180°⇒90°+∠APQ+20°=180°⇒110°+∠APQ=180°⇒∠APQ=180°-110°=70°
∠PBC = ∠APQ = 70°            (Corresponding angles)
Since ∠PRC+∠z=180°           Linear pair
∴∠z=180°-70°=110°    ∠APQ=∠PRC   Alternate interior angles

data.questionHtml: In Fig., PQ || RS. Find the value of x.
data.solutionHtml: ∠RCD+∠RCB=180° Linear pair⇒∠RCB=180°-130°=50°In △ABC, ∠BAC+∠ABC+∠BCA=180°       Angle sum property⇒∠BAC=180°-55°-50°=75°

data.questionHtml: In Fig., AB || CD and AE || CF; ∠FCG = 90° and ∠BAC = 120°. Find the values of x, y and z.
data.solutionHtml:
∠BAC = ∠ACG = 120°          (Alternate interior angle)
∴ ∠ACF + ∠FCG = 120°  
⇒ ∠ACF = 120° − 90° = 30°

∠DCA + ∠ACG = 180°            (Linear pair)
⇒∠x = 180° − 120° = 60°

∠BAC + ∠BAE + ∠EAC = 360°
∠CAE = 360° − 120° − (60° + 30°) = 150°             (∠BAE =  ∠DCF)

data.questionHtml: In Fig., AB || CD and AC || BD. Find the values of x, y, z.
data.solutionHtml:
(i) Since AC || BD and CD || AB, ABCD is a parallelogram.
∠CAB + ∠ACD = 180°     (Sum of adjacent angles of a parallelogram)
∴ ∠ACD = 180° − 65° = 115°
∠CAD = ∠CDB = 65°         (Opposite angles of a parallelogram)
∠ACD = ∠DBA = 115°       (Opposite angles of a parallelogram)

(ii) Here,
AC || BD and CD || AB
∠DAC = x = 40°            (Alternate interior angle)
∠DAB = y = 35°            (Alternate interior angle)

data.questionHtml: In Fig., state which lines are parallel and why?
data.solutionHtml:
Let F be the point of intersection of line CD and the line passing through point E.



Since ∠ACD and ∠CDE are alternate and equal angles, so
∠ACD = 100° = ∠CDE
∴ AC || EF

data.questionHtml: In Fig. 87, the corresponding arms of ∠ABC and ∠DEF are parallel. If ∠ABC = 75°, find ∠DEF.
data.solutionHtml:
Construction: Let G be the point of intersection of lines BC and DE.

∵ AB || DE and BC || EF

∴ ∠ABC=∠DGC=∠DEF=75°  (Corresponding angles)​

data.questionHtml:
The sum of an angle and one third of its supplementary angle is 90°. The measure of the angle is
(a) 135°
(b) 120°
(c) 60°
(d) 45°
data.solutionHtml:
Let the required angle be x.
Now, supplementary of the required angle = 180∘ − x
Then,
x+13180°-x=90°⇒3x+180°-x=270°⇒2x=90°⇒x=45°
Hence, the correct answer is option (d).

data.questionHtml:
If angles of a linear pair are equal, then the measure of each angle is
(a) 30°
(b) 45°
(c) 60°
(d) 90°
data.solutionHtml:
Let the required angle be x
Now, Sum of linear pair angles = 180∘
⇒ x + x = 180∘
⇒ 2x = 180∘
⇒ x = 90∘
Hence, the correct answer is option (d).

data.questionHtml:
Two complemntary angles are in the ratio 2 : 3. The measure of the larger angle is
(a) 60°
(b) 54°
(c) 66°
(d) 48°
data.solutionHtml:
Let the angles be 2x and 3x.
Now, 2x + 3x = 90∘
⇒ 5x = 90∘
⇒ x = 18∘ 
∴ Larger angle = 3x = 3 × 18∘ = 54∘ 
Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

data.questionHtml:
An angle is thrice its supplement. The measure of the angle is
(a) 120°
(b) 105°
(c) 135°
(d) 150°
data.solutionHtml:
Let the required angle be x. 
Then,
x=3180°-x⇒x=540°-3x⇒4x=540°⇒x=135°
Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

data.questionHtml:
In Fig. 88 PR is a straight line and ∠PQS : ∠SQR = 7 : 5. The measure of ∠SQR is
(a) 60°
(b) 6212°
(c) 6712°
(d) 75°
data.solutionHtml:
Let the measures of the angle ∠PQS and ∠SQR be 7x and 5x.
Now, ∠PQS + ∠SQR = 180∘             [Linear pair angles]
⇒ 7x + 5x = 180∘
⇒ 12x = 180∘
⇒ x = 15∘ 
∴ ∠SQR = 5x = 5 × 15∘ = 75∘ 
Hence, the correct answer is option (d).

data.questionHtml:
The sum of an angle and half of its complementary angle is 75°. The measure of the angle is
(a) 40°
(b) 50°
(c) 60°
(d) 80°
data.solutionHtml:
Let the required angle be x.
Now, complementnary of the required angle = 90∘ − x
Then,
x+1290°-x=75°⇒2x+90°-x=150°⇒x=150-90°⇒x=60°
Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

data.questionHtml:
∠A is an obtuse angle. The measure of ∠A and twice its supplementary differ by 30°. Then ∠A can be
(a) 150°
(b) 110°
(c) 140°
(d) 120°
data.solutionHtml:
Supplementary of ∠A = 180∘ − ∠A
Now,
∠A + 30∘ = 2(180∘ − ∠A)
⇒ ∠A + 30∘ = 360∘ − 2∠A
⇒ 3∠A = 360∘ − 30∘
⇒ 3∠A = 330∘
⇒ ∠A = 110∘
Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

data.questionHtml:
An angle is double of its supplement. The measure of the angle is
(a) 60°
(b) 120°
(c) 40°
(d) 80°
data.solutionHtml:
Let the required angle be x.
Now, supplementary of the required angle = 180∘ − x
Then,
x=2180°-x⇒x=360°-2x⇒3x=360°⇒x=120°
Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

data.questionHtml:
The measure of an angle which is its own complement is
(a) 30°
(b) 60°
(c) 90°
(d) 45°
data.solutionHtml:
Let the required angle be x.
Now, complementary of the required angle = 90∘ − x
Then,
x=90°-x⇒x=90°-x⇒2x=90°⇒x=45°
Hence, the correct answer is option (d).

data.questionHtml:
Two supplementary angles are in the ratio 3 : 2. The smaller angle measures
(a) 108°
(b) 81°
(c) 72°
(d) 68°
data.solutionHtml:
Let the angles be 3x and 2x.
Now, 3x + 2x = 180∘
⇒ 5x = 180∘
⇒ x = 36∘ 
∴ Smaller angle = 2x = 2 × 36∘ = 72∘ 
Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

data.questionHtml:
In Fig. 89, the value of x is
(a) 75
(b) 65
(c) 45
(d) 55
data.solutionHtml:
∠AOC and ∠BOC = 180∘             [∵ Linear pair angles]
⇒ 44∘+ (2x + 6)∘ = 180∘
⇒ (2x + 6)∘ = 136∘
⇒ 2x + 6 = 136
⇒ 2x = 130
⇒ x = 65
Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

data.questionHtml:
In Fig. 90, AOB is a straight line and the ray OCstands on it. The value of x is
(a) 16
(b) 26
(c) 36
(d) 46
data.solutionHtml:
∠AOC + ∠BOC = 180∘             [∵ Linear pair angles]
⇒ (2x + 15)∘ + (3x + 35)∘ = 180∘
⇒ (5x + 50)∘ = 180∘
⇒ 5x + 50 = 180
⇒ 5x = 130
⇒ x = 26
Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

data.questionHtml:
In Fig. 91, AOB is a straight line and 4x = 5y. The value of x is
(a) 100
(b) 105
(c) 110
(d) 115
data.solutionHtml:
∠AOC + ∠BOC = 180∘             [∵ Linear pair angles]
⇒ y∘ + x∘ = 180∘
⇒ y + x = 180
⇒4x5+x=180               ∵4x=5y⇒y=4x5⇒4x+5x=180×5⇒9x=180×5⇒x=100
Hence, the correct answer is option (a).

data.questionHtml:
In Fig. 92, AOB is a straight line such that ∠AOC = (3x + 10)°, ∠COD = 50° and ∠BOD = (x − 8)°. The value of x is
(a) 32
(b) 36
(c) 42
(d) 52
data.solutionHtml:
∠AOC + ∠COD + ∠BOD = 180∘             [AOB is a straight line]
⇒ (3x + 10)∘ + 50∘ + (x − 8)∘ = 180∘
⇒ 3x + 10 + 50 + x − 8 = 180
⇒ 4x + 52 = 180
⇒ 4x = 128
⇒ x = 32
Hence, the correct answer is option (a).

data.questionHtml:
In Fig. 93, if AOC is a straight line, then x =
(a) 42°
(b) 52°
(c) 142°
(d) 38°
data.solutionHtml:
∠AOD + ∠DOB + ∠BOC = 180∘             [∵ AOC is a straight line]
⇒ 38∘ + x + 90∘ = 180∘
⇒ x + 128∘ = 180∘
⇒ x = 52∘
Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

data.questionHtml:
In Fig. 94, if  ∠AOC is a straight line, then the value of x is
(a) 15
(b) 18
(c) 20
(d) 16
data.solutionHtml:
∠AOD + ∠DOB + ∠BOC = 180∘             [ AOC is a straight line]
⇒ 2x∘ + 90∘ + 3x∘ = 180∘
⇒ 5x∘ + 90∘ = 180∘
⇒ 5x = 90
⇒ x = 18
Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

data.questionHtml:
In Fig. 95, if AB, CD and EF are straight lines, then x =
(a) 5
(b) 10
(c) 20
(d) 30
data.solutionHtml:
Let all the lines intersect at O.


∠COF = ∠DOE = 4x∘                              [Vertically opposite angles]
∠AOC + ∠COF + ∠BOF = 180∘             [AOB is a straight line]
⇒ 2x∘ + 4x∘ + 3x∘ = 180∘
⇒ 9x∘ = 180∘
⇒ 9x = 180
⇒ x = 20
Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

data.questionHtml:
In Fig. 96, if AB, CD and EF are straight lines, then x + y + z =
(a) 180
(b) 203
(c) 213
(d) 134
data.solutionHtml:
∠DAE + ∠BAD + ∠BAF = 180∘             [EAF is a straight line]
⇒ 3x∘ + 49∘ + 62∘ = 180∘
⇒ 3x∘ + 111∘ = 180∘
⇒ 3x∘ = 69∘
⇒ 3x = 69
⇒ x = 23
Now, ∠CAE + ∠CAF = 180∘             [∵ EAF is a straight line]
⇒ z∘ + y∘ = 180∘
⇒ z + y = 180
Now, x + y + z = 23 + 180 = 203
Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

data.questionHtml:
In Fig. 97, if AB is parallel to CD, then the value of ∠BPE is
(a) 106°
(b) 76°
(c) 74°
(d) 84°
data.solutionHtml:
Since, AB || CD
∴ ∠BPQ = ∠PQC           [Alternate interior angles]
⇒ (3x + 34)∘ = (5x − 14)∘
⇒ 3x + 34 = 5x − 14
⇒ 48 = 2x
⇒ x = 24
∴ ∠BPQ = (3 × 24 + 34)∘ = 106∘
∠BPQ + ∠BPE = 180∘             [EF is a straight line]
⇒ 106∘ + ∠BPE = 180∘
⇒ ∠BPE = 74∘
Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

data.questionHtml:
In Fig. 98, if AB is parallel to CO and EF is a transversal, then x =
(a) 19
(b) 29
(c) 39
(d) 49
data.solutionHtml:
Let the line EF intersect AB and CD at P and Q respectively.


Since, AB || CD
∴ ∠BPQ + ∠PQD = 180∘         (Angles on the same side of a transversal line are supplementary)
⇒ (7x − 12)∘ + (4x + 17)∘ = 180∘
⇒ 7x − 12 + 4x + 17 = 180
⇒ 11x + 5 = 180
⇒ 11x = 175
⇒ x = 15.90

Disclaimer: No option is correct.

data.questionHtml:
In Fig. 99, AB || CD and EF is a transversal intersecting ABand CO at Pand Q respectively. The measure of  ∠DPQ is
(a) 100∘
(b) 80∘
(c) 110∘
(d) 70∘
data.solutionHtml:
∠BQF = ∠AQP = (4x)∘             [Vertically opposite angles]
Since, AB || CD
∴ ∠AQP + ∠CPQ = 180∘         [Angles on the same side of a transversal line are supplementary]
⇒ (4x)∘ + (5x)∘ = 180∘
⇒ 9x  = 180
⇒ x = 20
∴ ∠BQF = (4 × 20)∘ = 80∘
 Now, ∠BQF = ∠DPQ = 80∘          [Corresponding angles]
Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

data.questionHtml:
In Fig. 100, AB || CO and EF is a transversal intersecting AB and CD at P and Q respective. The measure of ∠OOP is
(a) 65
(b) 25
(c) 115
(d) 105
data.solutionHtml:
∠BPE = ∠APQ = (5x − 10)∘        [Vertically opposite angles]
Since, AB || CD
∴ ∠APQ + ∠CQP = 180∘            [Angles on the same side of a transversal line are supplementary]
⇒ (5x − 10)∘ + (3x − 10)∘ = 180∘
⇒ 8x − 20  = 180
⇒ 8x = 200
⇒ x = 25
∴ ∠BPE = (5 × 25 − 10)∘ = 115∘
 Now, ∠BPE = ∠DQP = 115∘          [Corresponding angles]
Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

data.questionHtml:
In Fig. 101, AB || CD and EF is a transversal. The value of y − x is
(a) 30
(b) 35
(c) 95
(d) 25
data.solutionHtml:
Since, AB || CD
∴ ∠BPQ = ∠DQF         [Corresponding angles]
⇒ (5x − 20)∘ = (3x + 40)∘
⇒ 5x − 20 = 3x + 40
⇒ 2x = 60
⇒ x = 30
∴ ∠BPQ = (5 × 30 − 20 )∘ = 130∘
Now, ∠APE  = ∠BPQ           [Vertically opposite angles]
⇒ 2y∘ = 130∘
⇒ y = 65
∴ y − x = 65 − 30 = 35
Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

data.questionHtml:
In Fig. 102, AB || CD || EF, ∠ABG = 110°, ∠GCO = 100° and ∠BGC = x°. The value of x is
(a) 35
(b) 50
(c) 30
(d) 40
data.solutionHtml:
Since, AB || EG
∴ ∠ABG + ∠EGB = 180∘         (Angles on the same side of a transversal line are supplementary)
⇒ 110∘ + ∠EGB = 180∘
⇒ ∠EGB = 70∘
Again, CD || GF
∴ ∠DCG + ∠FGC = 180∘         (Angles on the same side of a transversal line are supplementary)
⇒ 100∘ + ∠FGC = 180∘
⇒ ∠FGC = 80∘
Now, ∠EGB + ∠BGC +∠FGC = 180∘  
⇒ 70∘ + x∘ + 80∘ = 180∘
⇒ 150∘+ x∘ = 180∘
⇒ x∘ = 30∘
⇒ x = 30
Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

data.questionHtml:
In Fig. 103, PO || RS and ∠PAB = 60° and ∠ACS = 100°. Then, ∠BAC =
(a) 40°
(b) 60°
(c) 80°
(d) 50°
data.solutionHtml:
Since, PQ || RS
∴ ∠PAC = ∠ACS = 100∘      [Corresponding angles]
Now, ∠PAC = 100∘
⇒ ∠PAB + ∠BAC = 100∘ 
⇒ 60∘ + ∠BAC = 100∘ 
⇒ ∠BAC = 40∘ 
Hence, the correct answer is option (a).

data.questionHtml:
In Fig. 104, AB || CO, ∠OAB = 150° and ∠OCO = 120°. Then, ∠AOC =
(a) 80°
(b) 90°
(c) 70°
(d) 100°
data.solutionHtml:
Construction: Draw a line OE from the point O parallel to AB and CD


Since, AB || OE
∴ ∠BAO + ∠AOE = 180∘         [Angles on the same side of a transversal line are supplementary]
⇒ 150∘ + ∠AOE = 180∘
⇒ ∠AOE = 30∘
Again, CD || OE
∴ ∠DCO + ∠COE = 180∘         [Angles on the same side of a transversal line are supplementary]
⇒ 120∘ + ∠COE = 180∘
⇒ ∠COE = 60∘
Now, ∠AOC = ∠AOE + ∠COE
= 30∘ + 60∘
= 90∘
Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

data.questionHtml:
In Fig. 105, if AOB and COD are straight lines. Then, x + y =
(a) 120
(b) 140
(c) 100
(d) 160
data.solutionHtml:
∠AOD + ∠BOD = 180∘         [Linear pair angles]
⇒ (7x − 20)∘ + 3x∘ = 180∘
⇒ 7x − 20 + 3x = 180
⇒ 10x = 200
⇒ x = 20
∴ ∠AOD = (7 × 20 − 20)∘ = 120∘
Now∠AOD = ∠BOC = 120∘                [Vertically opposite angles]
∴ y = 120
Now, x + y = 20 + 120
= 140
Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

data.questionHtml:
In Fig. 106, the value of x is
(a) 22
(b) 20
(c) 21
(d) 24
data.solutionHtml:
(8x − 41)∘ + (3x)∘ + (3x + 10)∘ + (4x − 5)∘= 360∘
⇒ 8x − 41 + 3x + 3x + 10 + 4x − 5 = 360
⇒ 18x − 36 = 360
⇒ 18x = 396
⇒ x = 22
Hence, the correct answer is option (a).

data.questionHtml:
In Fig. 107, if AOBand COD are straight lines, then
(a) x = 29, y = 100
(b) x = 110, y = 29
(c) x = 29, y = 110
(d) x = 39, y = 110
data.solutionHtml:
∠AOD + ∠BOD = 180∘         [Linear pair angles]
⇒ y∘ + 70∘ = 180∘
⇒ y∘ = 110∘
⇒ y = 110
Now, ∠AOC = ∠BOD = 70∘                [Vertically opposite angles]
Now, ∠AOC + ∠COE + ∠EOB + ∠BOD + ∠AOD = 360∘            [Complete angle]
⇒ 70∘ + 28∘ + (3x − 5)∘ + 70∘ + 110∘ = 360∘
⇒ (3x)∘ + 273∘ = 360∘
⇒ 3x = 87
⇒ x = 29
Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

data.questionHtml:
In Fig. 108, if AB || CD then the value of x is
(a) 87
(b) 93
(c) 147
(d) 141
data.solutionHtml:
Construction: Draw a line PQ parallel to AB which is also parallel to CD
∠FCD + Reflex∠FCD = 360∘         (Complete angle)
⇒ ∠FCD + 273∘ =  360∘
⇒ ∠FCD = 87∘
Since, PQ || CD
∴∠QFC + ∠FCD = 180∘                 (Angles on the same side of a transversal line are supplementary)
⇒ ∠QFC + 87∘ = 180∘
⇒ ∠QFC = 93∘
Now, ∠ABF = ∠BFQ              (Corresponding angles)
= ∠BFC + ∠QFC
= 54∘ + 93∘
= 147∘
∴ x∘ = 147∘
⇒ x = 147
Hence, the correct answer is option (c).

data.questionHtml:
In Fig. 109, if AB || CD then the value of x is
(a) 34
(b) 124
(c) 24
(d) 158
data.solutionHtml:
Construction: Draw a line PQ parallel to AB which is also parallel to CD
∠QEC + ∠ECD = 180∘                 [Angles on the same side of a transversal line are supplementary]
⇒ ∠QEC + 56∘ = 180∘
⇒ ∠QEC = 124∘
Now, ∠BEQ + ∠QEC = ∠BEC      
⇒ ∠BEQ + 124∘ = 158∘
⇒ ∠BEQ = 34∘
Now, ∠ABE = ∠BEQ = 34∘              [Corresponding angles]
∴ x∘ = 34∘
⇒ x = 34
Hence, the correct answer is option (a).

data.questionHtml:
In Fig. 110, if AB || CD. The value of x is
(a) 122
(b) 238
(c) 58
(d) 119
data.solutionHtml:
Construction: Draw a line PQ parallel to AB which is also parallel to CD
Since, PQ || CD
∴ ∠EFC = ∠FEQ = 37∘                 [Alternate angles]
Now, ∠AEQ + ∠FEQ = ∠AEF    
⇒ ∠AEQ + 37∘ = 95∘
⇒ ∠AEQ = 58∘
Since, PQ || AB
∴∠EAB + ∠AEQ = 180∘                 [Angles on the same side of a transversal line are supplementary]
⇒ ∠EAB + 58∘ = 180∘
⇒ ∠EAB = 122∘
∠EAB + Reflex∠EAB = 360∘              [Complete angle]
∴ 122∘ + (2x)∘ = 360∘
⇒ 2x = 238
⇒ x = 119
Hence, the correct answer is option (d).

data.questionHtml:
In Fig. 111, if AB || CO then x =
(a) 154
(b) 139
(c) 144
(d) 164
data.solutionHtml:
Construction: Draw a line PQ parallel to AB which is also parallel to CD
Since, PQ || AB
∴ ∠AME + ∠QEM = 180∘                [Angles on the same side of a transversal line are supplementary]
⇒ 139∘ + ∠QEM = 180∘ 
⇒ ∠QEM = 41∘
Now, ∠QEM + ∠DEQ = ∠MED   
⇒ 41∘ + ∠DEQ = 67∘
⇒ ∠DEQ = 26∘
Now, ∠PED + ∠DEQ = 180∘                 [Linear Pair angles]
⇒ ∠PED + 26∘ = 180∘
⇒ ∠PED = 154∘
Since, PQ || AB
∴ x∘ = ∠PED                                         [Corresponding angles]
⇒ x∘ = 154∘
⇒ x = 154
Hence, the correct answer is option (a).

data.questionHtml:
In Fig. 112, if AB || CD, then x =
(a) 32
(b) 42
(c) 52
(d) 31
data.solutionHtml:
Construction: Draw a line PQ parallel to AB which is also parallel to CD
∠CDP + Reflex∠CDP = 360∘              [Complete angle]
∴∠CDP + 249∘ = 360∘
⇒ ∠CDP = 111∘
Since, PQ || AB
∴ ∠BAP = ∠APQ                                         [Alternate angles]
⇒ ∠BAP = 28∘
Now, ∠APQ + ∠QPD = ∠APD  
⇒ 28∘ + ∠QPD = (2x + 13)∘
⇒ ∠QPD = (2x + 13)∘ − 28∘
Since, PQ || CD
∴ ∠QPD + ∠CDP = 180∘                [Angles on the same side of a transversal line are supplementary]
⇒ (2x + 13)∘ − 28∘ + 111∘ = 180∘ 
⇒ 2x + 13 − 28 + 111 = 180
⇒ 2x = 84
⇒ x = 42
Hence, the correct answer is option (b).

data.questionHtml:
In Fig. 113 if AC || OF and AB || CE, then
(a) x = 145, y = 223
(c) x = 135, y = 233
(b) x = 223, y = 145
(d) x = 233, y = 135
data.solutionHtml:
Construction: Produce FD towards D to the point M
∠DCA + Reflex∠DCA = 360∘              [Complete angle]
∴∠DCA + (y + 15)∘ = 360∘
⇒ ∠DCA = 345∘ − y∘
Now,
∠MDC = ∠EDF = 58∘                                    [Vertically Opposite angles]
Since, MF || AC
∴ ∠MDC + ∠QPD = 180∘                                [Angles on the same side of a transversal line are supplementary]
⇒ 58∘ + 345∘ − y∘ = 180∘
⇒ y = 223
∴ ∠DCA = 345∘ − 223∘ = 122∘
Again, ∠BAC + Reflex∠BAC = 360∘              [Complete angle]
∴∠BAC + (2x + 12)∘ = 360∘
⇒ ∠DCA = 348∘ − (2x)∘
Since, AB || CD
∴ ∠DCA + ∠DCA = 180∘                [Angles on the same side of a transversal line are supplementary]
⇒ 348∘ − (2x)∘ + 122∘ = 180∘ 
⇒ (2x)∘ = 290∘
⇒ x = 145
Hence, the correct answer is option (a).
